resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: Calton Hill A UNESCO World Heritage Site, Calton Hill is a hill situated on the eastern end of Princes Street and encompasses several neoclassical structures, including the Nelson and National Monuments. A lithograph of the National Monument by T. Picken after J. D. Harding, from the University of Edinburgh Library's collections
resource.chars:
Calton Hill

A UNESCO World Heritage Site, Calton Hill is a hill situated on the eastern end of Princes Street and encompasses several neoclassical structures, including the Nelson and National Monuments.

A lithograph of the National Monument by T. Picken after J. D. Harding, from the University of Edinburgh Library's collections

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: Scott Monument Victorian gothic monument to Sir Walter Scott. Two bars of soap from the 20th century with images of the Scott Monument and Edinburgh Castle, from the University of Edinburgh Library's collections
resource.chars:
Scott Monument

Victorian gothic monument to Sir Walter Scott.

Two bars of soap from the 20th century with images of the Scott Monument and Edinburgh Castle, from the University of Edinburgh Library's collections

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: Bass Rock Island in the Firth of Forth  An early lithograph of Bass Rock from the University of Edinburgh Library's collections, engraved by William Miller after Joseph Mallord William Turner, 1826
resource.chars:
Bass Rock

Island in the Firth of Forth 

An early lithograph of Bass Rock from the University of Edinburgh Library's collections, engraved by William Miller after Joseph Mallord William Turner, 1826

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text:
The National (National Galleries of Scotland)
The National Galleries of Scotland comprises of three Edinburgh galleries (the National, Modern and Portrait galleries). The National gallery houses Scottish and international art from the Renaissance to the 20th century.
<a href="https://www.nationalgalleries.org/visit/scottish-national-gallery" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Visitor information
resource.chars:
The National (National Galleries of Scotland)

The National Galleries of Scotland comprises of three Edinburgh galleries (the National, Modern and Portrait galleries). The National gallery houses Scottish and international art from the Renaissance to the 20th century.

Visitor information
